course_title: Special Top Adv Study:English: Hardy, Stevenson, Toomer
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Complete Topic - Three Poet Novelists: Hardy, Stevenson, Toomer)
(This seminar will seek to explore three very different late-nineteenth and early-twentieth century male writers who worked powerfully in both verse poetry and prose fiction. It will investigate the concrete details of a substantial portion of each writer's work in both major genres in order to begin to establish some critical understanding of their relations, affordances, powers, limitations, and inter-penetrations. Jude the Obscure, The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, and Cane and major poems by each author will be studied in detail. Students will compose a lively argumentative essay that will engage with published discourse on genre, sub-genre, form, prosody, narrative, and prose poetics.)
course_description: Intensive study of specific literary topics, e.g., questions of form or history, or concentrations on one or more authors or literary movements. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
